tei:transcription.tei:p: Über Vorschlag des Herrn Dr. Robert Hirschfeld| Click on Robert Hirschfeld. und auf Wunsch unserer Collegen richten wir an Sie die höfliche Einladung, im Rahmen unserer Vereinigung einen Vortragscyclus über den Bau der IX. Sinfonie von Beethoven abzuhalten. The Foreword to S’s monograph Beethoven’s Neunte Sinfonie reports this invitation; the lectures, he reports, were never given, but: “the invitation by my publisher to transform this work into a monograph has provided the opportunity to make it accessible in a significantly expanded and enriched form to a larger public.” ( p. V; Eng. trans. by John Rothgeb, p. 3).

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from the Vereinigung Wiener Musikreferenten (Theodor Antropp and Paul Stauber) to Schenker, dated September 30, 1910

tei:translation.tei:p: [letterhead: Union of Viennese Music Critics] Vienna, September 30, 1910

At the suggestion of Dr. Robert Hirschfeld, and at the instigation of our colleagues, we take pleasure in extending to you the invitation to give a lecture series on the construction of Beethoven’s Ninth Symphony under the auspices of our Union.
So that we can make further arrangements, we would ask you, if your time permits, kindly to {2} join us on Monday October 3 at 6 p.m. in the Caffee Imperial.
In any case, we should be grateful for a communication from you (Stauber, [Vienna] IX, Währingerstraße 31), and we remain,
|The President: |The Secretary:| |[signed:] Th. Antropp |[signed:] Paul Stauber|
